text: [music playing]

MICHAEL SHEA: Hey,
I'm Michael Shea,

and you are up in
the club at "Rum
Club" in southeast Portland.

We are located in
the Central Eastside

Industrial District, which is
right across from Downtown.

We do have an excellent
cocktail scene here.

And if you come to
Portland, you have
to try a rum club daiquiri.
It is a go-to drink.

For lack of a better
word, a modern classic.

The rum club
daiquiri is a rip-off
of the classic daiquiri.

This is not the
daiquiri that you

necessarily see when
you go to Las Vegas,
or when you go to New Orleans.

This is a more balanced,
adult cocktail.

It is a handshake and
drink that really opens

people's eyes up
with how to drink rum
and how to enjoy cocktails.

Rum, lime, and sugar,
it's a holy trinity,

it's a very, very
simple cocktail.

This recipe extrapolated on
that by changing a few things,

using a richer sugar, using a
little bit of bitters, which

is not traditional, using
a little absinthe, which

is an old Tiki trick, and
making it into something that
became a signature cocktail.

And it's really become the
flagship of what "Rum Club" is,

and what our whole idea and
philosophy of cocktail making
is.
Cool.

To make a rum club
daiquiri we use two ounces
of aged Anejo Puerto Rican rum.
Some fresh lime juice.
Unrefined sugar.
We're using demerara sugar here.
A little bit of maraschino.
Angostura bitters.
And a few drops of absinthe.

When you take a sip you get
the richness in the Anejo
rum and the demerara sugar.

The fresh lime is
very, very refreshing.

The bitterness of
the angostura bitters
keeps it really super balanced.

And then there's a whisper of
the absinthe in the background.

It kind of gives a little bit
of mystery to the cocktail.
[music playing]
